revised_title: On the Alteration of Thermal Conductivity of Iron and Steel due to Magnetism
tldr: The author conducted experiments to study the effect of magnetism on the thermal conductivity of iron and steel. They discovered that magnetizing iron and steel longitudinally decreases the flow of heat by about 1%, while magnetizing it transversely increases the flow of heat by about 1%. This research provides insights into the relationship between magnetism and heat transfer in materials.
